name: Completris
description:
Have you ever thought that being able to choose how many squares make up the game pieces in those classic falling block games would be a good idea? I used to once. And you can be disabused of that idea too!

Five squares, six squares, ten squares, two hundred and fifty squares? This game has you covered all the way up to nine hundred and ninety nine. I mean, if you want. You don't, but you know, you can.

Featuring such features, like:

  • Next Piece Display - See the next piece that you will be presented with.
  • Wall kicks - Rotate unimpeded next to walls and adjacent to locked in game pieces.
  • Delayed Auto Shift - Pinpoint controls allow for exact piece positioning.
  • Lock Delay - Slide your game piece with ease before it gets locked down.
  • Spawn Delay - Translate and rotate the game piece before it descends into the playfield.
  • Procedurally Generated Game Pieces - You'll never get the shape you want.
  • Best Scores Saved - Brag to your family and friends.
  • Runs In A Window - Watch YouTube videos as you play.

What features aren't featured:

  • Ghost Piece - No indicator to show where the current piece will land.
  • Instant Drop - You can't instantly drop the block all the way down.
  • Hold Queue - You get what you're given.
  • Adverts - I'm not a fan of those.
